text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs to reach his apartment on the 10th floor.
However, on rainy days and when other people are in the elevator, he goes directly to the 10th floor in the elevator.

Why does he normally get off on the 7th floor? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I need to figure out why the man gets off on the 7th floor when he takes the elevator in the morning.
Let me break this down step by step.
First, the man lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor.
That's straightforward.
Then, in the evening, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor.
But on rainy days or when other people are in the elevator, he goes directly to the 10th floor.

So, why does he usually get off on the 7th floor otherwise?

Hmm, maybe it has something to do with the elevator's behavior or the building's layout.
Let's think about how elevators work.
Typically, elevators have buttons from the ground floor to the top floor, and when you press a button, it stops at that floor.
But maybe in this building, the elevator doesn't go all the way up to the 10th floor every time.
Perhaps it only goes up to the 7th floor, and from there, the man walks up the stairs to his apartment.
Wait, but on rainy days or when there are other people in the elevator, he can go directly to the 10th floor.
That suggests that normally, the elevator doesn't go all the way up.
Maybe the building has an elevator that only goes up to the 7th floor, and then the man has to walk up the stairs from there.
But on rainy days or when the elevator is crowded, he can get off at the 10th floor without having to walk up the stairs, which would be inconvenient in the rain.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator doesn't go all the way up in the morning because it's going down, but in the evening, when he's going up, it stops at the 7th floor.
But that doesn't quite make sense because the problem says he takes the elevator down to the ground floor every morning, so the elevator must go up as well.
Wait, perhaps the elevator only stops at certain floors.
For example, maybe it stops at every floor from the ground floor up to the 7th floor, but skips the higher floors like the 8th, 9th, and 10th.
So when he presses the 10th floor button, the elevator doesn't go all the way, but stops at the 7th floor instead.
That would explain why he gets off at the 7th floor normally but can go directly to the 10th floor when it's not crowded or rainy.
So, in normal circumstances, the elevator goes up to the 7th floor, and the man walks up the stairs from there.
On rainy days or when others are in the elevator, the elevator goes all the way to the 10th floor, saving him the trouble of walking in the rain or dealing with a crowded elevator.
Yes, that makes sense.
The key point is that the elevator's maximum stop is the 7th floor, so he has to get off there and walk up.
But when conditions allow, he can go directly to his floor without the need to walk.

</think>

The man gets off on the 7th floor because the elevator only stops at the 7th floor.
On rainy days or when the elevator is occupied, it goes directly to the 10th floor, allowing him to bypass the stairs.
